timeline.headline: India Votes 2014
timeline.text:
Lokasabha Elections 2014 - Coverage of the Worlds Biggest Election

The 2014 general election is taking place in nine phases in India, the longest election in the country's history (except first election), from 7 April to 12 May 2014 to constitute the 16th Lok Sabha. Voting will take place in all 543 parliamentary constituencies of India to elect members of parliament in the Lok Sabha. The result of this election will be declared on 16 May, before the 15th Lok Sabha completes its constitutional mandate on 31 May 2014.
According to the Election Commission of India, the electoral population in 2014 is 814.5 million, the largest in the world. There is an increase in newly eligible voters of 100 million since the last general election in 2009. This will be the longest and the most expensive general election in the history of the country, with the Election Commission of India estimating that the election will cost the exchequer INR3,500 crore (US$577 million). - Wikipedia.

Whole world is interested in whats going on in India. This is my attempt to capture the essential good, bad and ugly part of this election.
By Thejesh GN
Report issues or suggestions on GitHub

date.headline: It’s official: Modi is BJP’s choice
date.text: The formal announcement came after the BJP Parliamentary Board, which Mr. Advani skipped, rubber stamped the nomination after the RSS made it loud and clear in recent days that it wants Mr. Modi’s name announced before the commencement of the ‘inauspicious’ fortnight on September 20.

asset.caption: It’s official: Modi is BJP’s choice

date.headline: Modi authoritarian and a bully, says Ramachandra Guha
date.text: The BJP's prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi is a "bully" and an "absolute authoritarian", historian Ramchandra Guha said on Wednesday. Guha said the Gujarat chief minister could "damage" the Indian democracy, but not "destroy" it.

asset.caption: Modi authoritarian and a bully, says Ramachandra Guha

date.headline: Frankly Speaking - Rahul Gandi
date.text: For the first time, Congress Vice President and Congress Poll Campaign Chief Rahul Gandhi opens up to an elaborate sit-down interview with TIMES NOW Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami.

asset.caption: Frankly Speaking - Rahul Gandi

date.headline: @narendramodi on twitter

asset.credit: Instead of telling those voting for Modi to drown, Dr. Abdullah should look at himself & his family in the mirror & see how they ruined J&K.

date.headline: Omar Abdullah: Modi should learn secularism from Kashmiris

asset.caption: Omar Abdullah: Modi should learn secularism from Kashmiris

date.headline: Twin blasts at Farooq Abdullah's rallies
date.text: After Khanyar, the second blast took place at Magam district of Jammu and Kashmir during Jammu & Kashmir National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah's rallies. Three people have been injured in the stampede after the explosion.

asset.caption: Twin blasts at Farooq Abdullah's rallies

date.headline: Kumar Vishwas attacked in Amethi
date.text: LUCKNOW: AAP leader Kumar Vishwas was attacked in Amethi on Friday evening. The attack took place at Singauli village in Jagdishpur block under Kamrauli police station where he had gone to campaign for Lok Sabha election.Vishwas is contesting against Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi. AAP workers alleged that attackers were Congress workers. They also claimed that over 15 AAP volunteers were injured in the attack. Kumar also sustained minor injuries, they claimed.

asset.caption: Kumar Vishwas attacked in Amethi

date.headline: Former Gujarat DGP joins AAP
date.text: RB Sreekumar, who took on Chief Minister Narendra Modi during the 2002 Gujarat riots and thereafter, registered himself with the AAP on Thursday night. Former Director General of Gujarat police RB Sreekumar, who took on Chief Minister Narendra Modi during the 2002 Gujarat riots and thereafter, for the series of alleged fake encounters of Muslims, has joined the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) claiming to fight corruption in high places.

asset.caption: Former Gujarat DGP joins AAP

date.headline: RSS to initiate legal action against Rahul Gandhi for accusing them of killing Mahatma Gandhi
date.text: Irked by Rahul Gandhi's remark accusing "RSS people" of having killed Mahatma Gandhi, the Sangh has decided to initiate legal action against him and lodge a complaint with the Election Commission.

asset.caption: RSS to initiate legal action against Rahul Gandhi for accusing them of killing Mahatma Gandhi

date.headline: Finding name is a big issue
date.text: Finding name is a big issue #indiavotes2014 #loksabha2014

date.headline: Voting day in Bangalore
date.text: Volunteers helping to find name in Jayanagar #loksabha2014 #indiavotes2014

date.headline: Voting day in Bangalore
date.text: This is where I voted. Govt Primary School, Kammasandra.

date.headline: Narendra Modi has weak credentials as PM candidate, mine better: Nitish Kumar to NDTV
date.text: Nitish Kumar, the chief minister of Bihar, today told NDTV that he is a far more worthy contender for prime minister than "others."  Without naming his political rival, Narendra Modi - a strategy he has perfected in months of attacks on the BJP's prime ministerial candidate - Mr Kumar demolished the BJP leader's credentials.

asset.caption: Narendra Modi has weak credentials as PM candidate, mine better: Nitish Kumar to NDTV

date.headline: Live: Cabinet recommends President’s rule in Delhi
date.text: The Union Cabinet, which met late this evening at Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's residence, has recommended that President's rule be imposed in Delhi and that the Assembly be kept under suspended animation.

asset.caption: Live: Cabinet recommends President’s rule in Delhi

date.headline: Arvind Kejriwal Resigns
Congress expels six MPs for disrupting Parliament over Telangana
date.text: NEW DELHI: Cracking the whip, Congress on Tuesday expelled six Lok Sabha MPs from Andhra Pradesh who opposed creation of Telangana and had given a notice of no-confidence motion against the government. The MPs expelled by Congress president Sonia Gandhi are Sabbam Hari, GV Harsha Kumar, V Arun Kumar, L Rajagopal, R Sambasiva Rao and A Sai Pratap.

asset.caption: Congress expels six MPs for disrupting Parliament over Telangana

date.headline: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16
date.text: For the first time, the Lok Sabha elections will be held in nine phases — from April 7 to May 12. Announcing the poll schedule on Wednesday, the Election Commisson of India said counting of votes will be done on May 16 and the results will be announced on the same day.

asset.caption: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16

date.headline: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16
date.text: For the first time, the Lok Sabha elections will be held in nine phases — from April 7 to May 12. Announcing the poll schedule on Wednesday, the Election Commisson of India said counting of votes will be done on May 16 and the results will be announced on the same day.

asset.caption: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16

date.headline: General Election 2014
date.text: The five year term of the 15th Lok Sabha is due to expire on 31st May, 2014. Credible elections, conducted at regular prescribed intervals, are the very soul of any democratic system. Article 324 of the Constitution of India bestows the relevant powers, duties and functions upon the Election Commission of India while Section 14 of the Representation of the People Act, 1951 provides for conduct of the elections to constitute a new Lok Sabha before the expiry of its current term. Taking into account these Constitutional and legal provisions, the Election Commission of India has made comprehensive preparations for conduct of elections to the 16th Lok Sabha in a free, fair and peaceful manner.

asset.caption: General Election 2014

date.headline: Lok Sabha elections in 9 phases to start from April 7
date.text: Lok Sabha elections will be held from April 7 to May 12 spread over nine days in the highest number of polling days so far involving an electorate of 81.4 crore, the Election Commission announced on Wednesday.

asset.caption: Lok Sabha elections in 9 phases to start from April 7

date.headline: State-wise map of Election dates for Lok Sabha polls 2014
date.text: Finally the Elections Commission has announced the date for the 2014 Lok Sabha elections, which will be held between April 7 and May 12 in nine phases. The counting of votes will be held on May 16.

asset.caption: State-wise map of Election dates for Lok Sabha polls 2014

date.headline: BJP’s ‘anti-Muslim Ambedkar’ pitch is a big, fat lie
date.text:
In the middle of the general elections, the Sangh Parivar has cleverly tried to spark a debate by suggesting that Dalit icon and author of India’s constitution, Dr. BR Ambedkar did not trust the Muslims.
Suddenly there were statements and TV channel discussions on how Ambedkar viewed the Muslims of India negatively. A nameless Twitter account holder, probably propped by the BJP, sent this writer a link to Ambedkar’s bunch of essays titled, Pakistan or The Partition of India, as proof that he did not view Indian Muslims positively. This work was sent to me because I had suggested that there was no evidence in any scholarly work that Ambedkar disliked the Muslims.

asset.caption: BJP’s ‘anti-Muslim Ambedkar’ pitch is a big, fat lie

date.headline: I am not Modi's doctor, I can't examine him: Khurshid
date.text: Minister Salman Khurshid, who stoked a controversy by calling Narendra Modi "impotent", on Wednesday insisted that he did nothing wrong as there was no other appropriate word to describe him in the context of the 2002 Gujarat riots.

asset.caption: I am not Modi's doctor, I can't examine him: Khurshid

date.headline: Mahatma's grandson Rajmohan Gandhi joins AAP, may contest from Delhi
date.text: New Delhi: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has got a shot in the arm. Eminent thinker and writer Dr Rajmohan Gandhi has officially joined the AAP on Friday. He has been a supporter of the AAP for a few months. Rajmohan Gandhi is likely to get an AAP ticket in the Lok Sabha polls. He is likely to contest from one of the seven seats in Delhi.

asset.caption: Mahatma's grandson Rajmohan Gandhi joins AAP, may contest from Delhi

date.headline: Modi blames Congress for 'depriving' Pranab of prime minister's post
date.text:
Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP's) prime minister nominee Narendra Modi on Wednesday once again accused the Congress of practising dynasty politics, blaming it for "depriving" Pranab Mukherjee of the PM's post at least twice.
Mukherjee, now the President of India, was the senior-most Congress leader in the Union cabinet after Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's assassination in 1984, Modi said, addressing a rally in Kolkata.

asset.caption: Modi blames Congress for 'depriving' Pranab of prime minister's post

date.headline: Modi says Congress sowing 'seeds of poison'
date.text: Hitting back at Congress president Sonia Gandhi for her “zeher ki kheti” remark, the Bharatiya Janata Party’s prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi on Sunday said it was the Congress, not the BJP, which was “sowing seeds of poison” with its divisive politics.

asset.caption: Modi says Congress sowing 'seeds of poison'

date.headline: AAP to come up with its corrupt list for States
date.text:
After its ‘corrupt list’ targeting national politicians, Aam Aadmi Party says it will release a list of leaders at the State-level with corrupt, criminal or dynastic background and field candidates against them.
“We will release the list of leaders at the state level. There are many leaders in different states whose names have not been announced by the party, but are symbols of corruption, criminalisation of politics and dynastic politics.

asset.caption: AAP to come up with its corrupt list for States

date.headline: Chidambaram questions Modi’s awareness of economic issues
date.text: Hitting back at BJP leader Arun Jaitley, Finance Minister P Chidambaram said he has "carefully avoided" questions that he had raised about Narendra Modi and asked why the Gujarat Chief Minister spoke nothing about various economic issues.

asset.caption: Chidambaram questions Modi’s awareness of economic issues

date.headline: UP better than Gujarat in terms of development: Akhilesh Yadav
date.text:
Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh on Thursday said that in terms of development, his state was in a better position than the Narendra Modi led Gujarat.
Addressing Yuva Shakti Sammelan Akhilesh said that Modi claimed development in Gujarat, but UP was placed in a better position than his state. He claimed that large number of welfare schemes being run in UP was not being done in any other state including Gujarat.

asset.caption: UP better than Gujarat in terms of development: Akhilesh Yadav

date.headline: BJP men ‘partied’ at zoo the night before 21 cheetals were found dead
date.text: A PARTY allegedly organised by a group of local BJP leaders at Bilaspur zoo on the night of January 14 could have been the reason for the death of 21 female cheetals or spotted deer in their zoo enclosure, locals have alleged.

asset.caption: BJP men ‘partied’ at zoo the night before 21 cheetals were found dead

date.headline: Gujarat LS polls: AAP set to gain in Modi heartland
date.text: As the campaign for the 2014 Lok Sabha polls gathers momentum, the Aam Aadmi Party is dreaming big in Gujarat, the home state of BJP's prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi. The one year old political party, which has barged onto the national political scene with a unthinkable result in the Delhi assembly election, is campaigning hard in Gujarat on their core issues like corruption and development.

asset.caption: Gujarat LS polls: AAP set to gain in Modi heartland

date.headline: MJ Akbar: AAP was a bubble waiting to burst; Rahul Gandhi too late for Congress
date.text: In an interview with ET Now, MJ Akbar, Editorial Director of The Sunday Guardian talks about Rahul Gandhi's first TV interview, the emergence of AAP and the prospects of a Narendra Modi-led NDA win in 2014 elections.

asset.caption: MJ Akbar: AAP was a bubble waiting to burst; Rahul Gandhi too late for Congress

date.headline: Delhi: Sikhs demand Congress reveal names of 1984 riots conspirators
date.text: New Delhi: Around 500 members of Sikh groups protested outside the Congress office here on Thursday demanding that the names of the party leaders involved in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots be revealed. The protest comes after Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi's admission during a television interview Monday that "some Congress men were probably involved" in the anti-Sikh riots that followed the assassination of then prime minister Indira Gandhi by her Sikh bodyguards.

asset.caption: Delhi: Sikhs demand Congress reveal names of 1984 riots conspirators

date.headline: ‘Rajiv Gandhi didn’t take calls from President after 1984 riots broke out’
date.text: Contradicting Rahul Gandhi’s assertion that the Congress government did everything it could to stop the anti-Sikh riots in Delhi in 1984, the then President Giani Zail Singh’s press secretary Wednesday alleged that the riots were “orchestrated and sponsored” and claimed that the then PM Rajiv Gandhi did not even take calls from the President when he tried to get in touch with him to discuss the situation.

asset.caption: ‘Rajiv Gandhi didn’t take calls from President after 1984 riots broke out’

date.headline: Jairam Ramesh and Priyanka prompted Rahul Gandhi from behind the camera during the recording of interview
date.text: The knives are out in the Congress after Rahul Gandhi’s poor show in his first full-length TV interview, which not only disappointed the party rank and file but also gave a handle to detractors to deride the Gandhi family. The debacle of an interview is now being blamed on inappropriate briefing given to the Gandhi scion on crucial issues.

asset.caption: Jairam Ramesh and Priyanka prompted Rahul Gandhi from behind the camera during the recording of interview

date.headline: Arvind Kejriwal disputes Narendra Modi's development claims after being snubbed, wants to meet him
date.text: AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal was Friday stopped while going to meet Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi, shortly after he alleged widespread corruption and unemployment in the state. Kejriwal was driving to the BJP prime ministerial candidate's residence here when police halted him and the rest of his convey and wanted to know if he had an appointment with Modi.

asset.caption: Arvind Kejriwal disputes Narendra Modi's development claims after being snubbed, wants to meet him

date.headline: Why Arvind Kejriwal may be ready to use violence as a political weapon
date.text: With the decimation of the Congress in the ensuing elections staring them in the face, the establishment in Delhi is desperate for survival. Arvind Kejriwal and the Aam Aadmi Party is their last resort to prevent a Narendra Modi-led government from coming into power.

asset.caption: Why Arvind Kejriwal may be ready to use violence as a political weapon

date.headline: AAP-BJP clashes: 14 arrested, FIR against Ashutosh, Shazia
date.text: New Delhi: Fourteen AAP members were arrested after Delhi Police registered an FIR in connection with the clashes outside the BJP national headquarters in New Delhi between supporters of the two parties that left 28 people injured.

asset.caption: AAP-BJP clashes: 14 arrested, FIR against Ashutosh, Shazia

date.headline: Muslims too secular, they should be communal: AAP’s Shazia Ilmi
date.text: "Muslims are not communal. They have become too secular. This time they should be communal. They should think for themselves. Muslims have become political slaves of the Congress, BJP and SP," she was heard as saying.

asset.caption: Muslims too secular, they should be communal: AAP’s Shazia Ilmi

date.headline: It's time to be communal, says Shazia Ilmi

asset.caption: It's time to be communal, says Shazia Ilmi

date.headline: On Twitter
While at a police station, AAP's Ashutosh wrote this blog
date.text: These are the classic symptoms of a fascist leader. Arvind Kejriwal was on a study tour of Gujarat to examine the claims of development and Narendra Modi knows if he allows that, his lies will be exposed.

asset.caption: While at a police station, AAP's Ashutosh wrote this blog

date.headline: Evict Muslims from Hindu areas: Pravin Togadia
date.text: Vishwa Hindu Parishad's (VHP) president Pravin Togadia sent temperatures soaring in Bhavnagar with a hate speech that targeted Muslims for buying properties in Hindu areas.

asset.caption: Evict Muslims from Hindu areas: Pravin Togadia

date.headline: Footage tells a different story but AAP politics based on lies: Arun Jaitley
date.text: Reacting to the case filed against Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) members, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Arun Jailtey on Thursday said that the footage that captured their pitched battles with BJP activists might be saying a different story but false propaganda and lies had become an integral part of the AAP politics.

asset.caption: Footage tells a different story but AAP politics based on lies: Arun Jaitley

date.headline: AAP took permission for Shiv Jayanti, organised election rally instead
date.text: The Aam Aadmi Party, which spares no time in flaying anyone with even a whiff of corruption or irregularity around them, itself broke a major BMC rule on Wednesday.  The party had taken permission from the civic body to hold a celebration of Shiv Jayanti at a playground in Andheri, but organised an election rally at the venue instead. For this, the BMC on Thursday issued them a notice and forfeited their Rs 2,200 deposit. According to the BMC rules, playgrounds cannot be use for political rallies.

asset.caption: AAP took permission for Shiv Jayanti, organised election rally instead

date.headline: India will have to accommodate Hindus from Bangladesh: Modi
date.text: Silchar (Assam): BJP's Prime Ministerial candidate Narendra Modi today said Hindu migrants from Bangladesh must be accommodated in the country and detention camps would be done away with once his party comes to power. "As soon as we come to power at the Centre, detention camps housing Hindu migrants from Bangladesh will be done away with," Modi told a public rally at Ramnagar here.

asset.caption: India will have to accommodate Hindus from Bangladesh: Modi

date.headline: Now, Delhi CM Kejriwal goes after Mukesh Ambani, Moily over gas; orders probe
date.text: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday directed the anti-corruption branch (ACB) of his government to register an FIR against Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) chairman Mukesh Ambani, petroleum minister Veerappa Moily, former petroleum minister Murli Deora and former director general of hydrocarbons VK Sibal for increasing the price of natural gas produced in India. The increase will cost the country Rs. 54,000 crore per year.

asset.caption: Now, Delhi CM Kejriwal goes after Mukesh Ambani, Moily over gas; orders probe

date.headline: AAP govt rewards protesters: 50% subsidy for those who supported Kejriwal's protest against power bills
date.text: NEW DELHI: Rewarding those who had supported them and refused to pay their power bills during AAP's agitation, the Delhi government on Wednesday decided to give them a 50 per cent relief on their pending bills and also waived the penalty.

asset.caption: AAP govt rewards protesters: 50% subsidy for those who supported Kejriwal's protest against power bills

date.headline: US visa not on agenda when Modi meets Powell in Gujarat
date.text: The recently confirmed meeting between BJP's prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi and US ambassador to India Nancy Powell will take place in Gandhinagar with the focus on how to take the bilateral relations forward without any conversation on US visa for Gujarat chief minister.

asset.caption: US visa not on agenda when Modi meets Powell in Gujarat

date.headline: AAP government seeks probe against Sheila Dikshit over unauthorized colonies
date.text: NEW DELHI: Opening yet another front against the Congress, the Kejriwal government has urged President Pranab Mukherjee to act against former Delhi chief minister Sheila Dikshit in fake provisional certificates for unauthorised colony scam.

asset.caption: AAP government seeks probe against Sheila Dikshit over unauthorized colonies

date.headline: ‘Chaiwala my PM’ gains momentum
date.text: Chaiwala my PM… has become the latest campaign theme of the Bharatiya Janata Party in the State for the Lok Sabha elections as the party is keen on politically cashing in on the “tea vendor” jibe at its prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi by Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar.

asset.caption: ‘Chaiwala my PM’ gains momentum

date.headline: AAP’s ‘aurat’ problem: The patent misogyny of mango men
date.text: "(Child and women development minister) Rakhi Birla and (law minister) Somnath Bharti were fighting against prostitution, drug addiction and protection of women," said AAP leader Sanjay Singh in an unwitting and revealing slip of tongue. Despite the hot counter-accusations of media lies, the fact remains that Bharti's late night raid in Khirki was indeed against the protection of women.

asset.caption: AAP’s ‘aurat’ problem: The patent misogyny of mango men

date.headline: Gujarat riots: NC, NCP differ with Congress, ask it to respect court order
date.text: New Delhi: With poll after opinion poll suggesting that the country is rooting for Narendra Modi as prime minister this time, parties on the other side of the political spectrum seem to be warming up to the taste of 'NaMo tea'.

asset.caption: Gujarat riots: NC, NCP differ with Congress, ask it to respect court order

date.headline: Nilekani takes social media by storm to woo voters
date.text: Log on to YouTube and you are most likely to see Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani making a speech about his “ideas for Bangalore,”  before you get a chance to see any other video.

asset.caption: Nilekani takes social media by storm to woo voters

date.headline: We cannot run away from politics or eliminate it as an option
date.text: Earlier this year, around the time New Year resolutions have yet to lose their shine, I met with a group of young people who work in the neighbourhoods of Bangalore. These 20-somethings mentor teenagers in low-income households across the city. They help them with information and advice on education and the skills that will get them employment. I talked to them that afternoon of my vision for a better Bangalore for the kind of city they needed and that met their aspirations.

asset.caption: We cannot run away from politics or eliminate it as an option

date.headline: Dalit villagers attacked for casting votes in Giridih
date.text: Dalit villagers were attacked lathis, with bricks and stones thrown at them by upper-caste Bhumihars when they tried to cast their vote in villages in Gardih village in Jamua block in Giridih. Jamua which falls in Koderma constituency was scheduled for polling in the first phase of elections on April 10. Dalit villagers here said they had tried to vote for CPI (ML) when they were stopped by Bhumihar villagers, supporters of BJP, who assaulted a Dalit woman from their hamlet while she was casting her vote leading to a scuffle.

asset.caption: Dalit villagers attacked for casting votes in Giridih

date.headline: Narendra Modi critics, expect no quarter, no mercy
date.text: When Dileep Padgaonkar (then TOI managing editor), B.G. Verghese and I went to Modi for an inquiry report in 2002, Modi took up the “Newton’s third law” story that the TOI had run, being most upset with it because it revealed how casually Modi took retaliatory violence.

asset.caption: Narendra Modi critics, expect no quarter, no mercy

date.headline: India TV journalist quits over ‘scripted’ Narendra Modi interview
date.text: Senior journalist and editorial director of India TV Qamar Waheed Naqvi resigned Monday from the Hindi news channel in protest against an allegedly “fixed” interview of the BJP’s prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi

asset.caption: India TV journalist quits over ‘scripted’ Narendra Modi interview

date.headline: LS polls: Karnataka sees voter turnout of 67.28 per cent
date.text: Bangalore, April 17: Twenty-eight constituencies in Karnataka went to the general election in the fifth phase on Thursday. The state has 4,62,11,844 voters and 434 candidates in the fray. Twenty-one among the 434 candidates are women.

asset.caption: LS polls: Karnataka sees voter turnout of 67.28 per cent

date.headline: Twitter @divyaspandana
date.text: #ramyaformandya here it is!! That's a thumbs up :) @karuna4s pic.twitter.com/WFzhcafyC7

asset.caption: Twitter @divyaspandana

date.headline: Twitter @nandannilekani
date.text: We voted :) pic.twitter.com/PDZQP2FUge

asset.caption: Twitter @nandannilekani

date.headline: Twitter @BSYBJP
date.text: My finger got inked at Shikaripur. Come out and cast your valuable vote. It's your right and duty. pic.twitter.com/bV2qu5QWl9

asset.caption: Twitter @BSYBJP

date.headline: Why I will not fall for the “Vote for PM” trick
date.text: Alright — so we’re all getting ready to vote throughout the country. Some states have already completed polling. Bengaluru's turn is tomorrow. How do you decide? This election, in particular, is seeing massive interest from all around the country. However, at least some of this interest is generated because of the silly way in which the Congress and BJP are continuing to differentiate themselves from each other, when the reality is far murkier.

asset.caption: Why I will not fall for the “Vote for PM” trick

date.headline: Bangalore: This 96-year-old has voted in every election since 1952
date.text: Bangalore: 96-year-old Lakshmi Karanth is perhaps the oldest voter in India. She has voted in every election since 1952. Her grandson and grand daughter-in-law escorted her on Thursday to a polling booth in Bangalore South Lok Sabha seat.

asset.caption: Bangalore: This 96-year-old has voted in every election since 1952

date.headline: BJP plaint against Muthalik
date.text: The BJP on Sunday filed a complaint against Independent candidate Pramod Muthalik on the grounds that he has made false propaganda against BJP’s candidate for Bangalore South H N Ananth Kumar. Muthalik had released a book ‘Ananthana Avanthara’ that has details about alleged scams and irregularities connected to the BJP candidate.  Muthalik said Ananth Kumar along with corporate lobbyist Niira Radia was involved in a Rs 5,000-crore scam and a petition is pending before the Supreme Court in this regard.

asset.caption: BJP plaint against Muthalik

date.headline: THE WEALTH OF CANDIDATES
date.text: Nandan Nilekani’s wealth, at Rs 7,710 cr, is rather striking. His wealth is more than the net assets of the next two hundred candidates. Put another way, his assets are more than those of every other Congress candidate, BJP candidate, independent candidate, BSP candidate, JD(U) candidate and AAP candidate put together.

asset.caption: THE WEALTH OF CANDIDATES

date.headline: Is India on a Totalitarian Path? Arundhati Roy on Corporatism, Nationalism and World’s Largest Vote
date.text: As voting begins in India in the largest elections the world has ever seen, we spend the hour with Indian novelist and essayist Arundhati Roy.

asset.caption: Is India on a Totalitarian Path? Arundhati Roy on Corporatism, Nationalism and World’s Largest Vote

date.headline: Modi praises graft-tainted BSY, says corruption in Cong womb
date.text: For the first time in his poll campaign, Modi shared the dais with former Karnataka chief minister B S Yeddyurappa who recently returned to the BJP after being exiled over corruption. The rally was primarily put together by the Yeddyurappa group to mark its return to the BJP.

asset.caption: Modi praises graft-tainted BSY, says corruption in Cong womb

date.headline: Infographic: How India forms a government
date.text: A tight race seems likely as 814 million voters elect leaders in world's largest democracy next week.

asset.caption: Infographic: How India forms a government

date.headline: An EVM that 'votes' only for BJP stuns poll staff in Assam
date.text: GUWAHATI: An electronic voting machine raised many eyebrows across the state during a mandatory mock poll in Jorhat on Tuesday. Every time a button was pressed, the vote went in favour of BJP.

asset.caption: An EVM that 'votes' only for BJP stuns poll staff in Assam

date.headline: Right-wing outfit molests Congress councillor
date.text: A mob of around 30 suspected Hindu Jagarana Vedike activists allegedly sexually assaulted a woman member of Mangalore City Corporation when she was canvassing for the Congress party on Sunday.

asset.caption: Right-wing outfit molests Congress councillor

date.headline: India digital bosses Nilekani and Balakrishnan vie for votes
date.text: Two of India's leading information technology figures - Nandan Nilekani and V Balakrishnan - hope to win over voters in Bangalore with their record of corporate success and transparency, reports Saritha Rai.

asset.caption: India digital bosses Nilekani and Balakrishnan vie for votes

date.headline: Taking on a 2,500-km train journey to listen to India's conversations about elections – and life
date.text: Aboard the Brahmaputra Mail as she travels across the country, Supriya Sharma finds that conflicts of the North East have many shades of gray.

asset.caption: Taking on a 2,500-km train journey to listen to India's conversations about elections – and life

date.headline: Modi files nomination papers in Varanasi
date.text: BJP prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi on Thursday filed his nomination papers for the Lok Sabha elections from Varanasi constituency, saying he had been called by “Mother Ganga” to contest from this holy city.

asset.caption: Modi files nomination papers in Varanasi

date.headline: Modi files nomination papers in Varanasi
date.text: BJP prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi on Thursday filed his nomination papers for the Lok Sabha elections from Varanasi constituency, saying he had been called by “Mother Ganga” to contest from this holy city.

asset.caption: Modi files nomination papers in Varanasi

date.headline: Ramdev is sorry, but FIR filed
date.text: As Baba Ramdev’s comments against Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi led to an uproar in political circles and Dalit groups, the police in Lucknow filed an FIR against the yoga guru on Saturday.

asset.caption: Ramdev is sorry, but FIR filed

date.headline: God save us from Gujarat model: Sonia Gandhi
date.text: BARNALA: Sonia Gandhi hit back at Narendra Modi by finding fault in his model of governance in Gujarat. Without naming him, she accused him of trying to usurp absolute power in his hand.

asset.caption: God save us from Gujarat model: Sonia Gandhi

date.headline: Congress could extend support to Third front to form govt: Khurshid
date.text: Union Minister Salman Khurshid on Saturday said Congress could consider extending support to the Third front or taking its help, if necessary to form the government at the Centre after Lok Sabha polls. He claimed that Narendra Modi was going to emerge as a “big problem” for BJP and referring to Ram temple movement, said that when “Bhagwan ki lehar” (God’s wave) could not stop Congress, then how can “Modi wave” stop it.

asset.caption: Congress could extend support to Third front to form govt: Khurshid

date.headline: BJP launches a scathing attack with Vadra CD, Priyanka Gandhi compares BJP to ‘panicky rats’
date.text: Hours after Priyanka Gandhi Vadra hit out at Narendra Modi again, the BJP Sunday launched its sharpest attack against her husband, releasing a strongly worded booklet and video targeting Robert Vadra. Titled ‘Damaad Shri’, the nearly 8-minute video accuses the Bhupinder Singh Hooda-led government in Haryana and the previous Ashok Gehlot-led regime in Rajasthan of helping Vadra grab land across the two states in violation of rules.

asset.caption: BJP launches a scathing attack with Vadra CD, Priyanka Gandhi compares BJP to ‘panicky rats’

date.headline: Modi hits out at Mamata over her paintings, TMC warns of defamation suit against him
date.text: The electoral battle in West Bengal took a personal turn on Sunday with BJP’s PM candidate Narendra Modi accusing West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee of helping people associated with the Saradha chit-fund scam and questioning the cost at which her paintings were sold.

asset.caption: Modi hits out at Mamata over her paintings, TMC warns of defamation suit against him

date.headline: There'll be no place in India for Modi critics, says BJP leader Giriraj Singh
date.text: Those who want to stop Narendra Modi (from becoming prime minister) are looking towards Pakistan. In the coming days, they will have no place in India. They will only have place in Pakistan, -  Giriraj Singh said while addressing a gathering in Godda district of Jharkhand.

asset.caption: There'll be no place in India for Modi critics, says BJP leader Giriraj Singh

date.headline: Farooq hits back: ‘Let Modi voters all jump into sea’
date.text: Union minister and National Conference president Farooq Abdullah said Sunday that Kashmir wouldn’t be part of an India that is “communal” and that those who “vote for Modi should jump into the sea”.

asset.caption: Farooq hits back: ‘Let Modi voters all jump into sea’

date.headline: Ahmedabad riot victims watch BJP's strategy in UP with a sense of déjà vu
date.text: The polarisation of UP in the wake of the Muzaffarnagar riots seems chillingly familiar to the residents of Naroda Patiya, where 97 Muslims were massacred on February 28, 2002.

asset.caption: Ahmedabad riot victims watch BJP's strategy in UP with a sense of déjà vu

date.headline: How free and fair are the world’s biggest elections?
date.text: The Election Commission would like to have you believe that poll rigging and booth capturing are history. But this election has seen plenty of both.

asset.caption: How free and fair are the world’s biggest elections?

date.headline: Assam poll team held for rigging
date.text: GUWAHATI: An entire team of polling officials, including the presiding officer, and two others — a village defence party member and a videographer — have been arrested on charges of booth capturing and rigging the polls on April 24 at a booth in Guwahati Lok Sabha constituency.

asset.caption: Assam poll team held for rigging

date.headline: Nagaland Congress leaders allege rigging during Lok Sabha polls
date.text: Congress leaders met the Chief Election Commissioner V S Sampath and submitted a complaint alleging large-scale proxy voting and poll rigging by the supporters of ruling Naga People's Front (NPF) during the April 9 Lok Sabha polls in Nagaland.

asset.caption: Nagaland Congress leaders allege rigging during Lok Sabha polls

date.headline: EC says sorry to ‘missing’ voters of Mumbai, Pune
date.text: The issue cropped at the EC briefing on Thursday, where details were given on the sixth phase of polling. “We will look into the matter and we apologise for the inconvenience caused to voters,” Election Commissioner H.S. Brahma said in response to questions about missing or deleted names.

asset.caption: EC says sorry to ‘missing’ voters of Mumbai, Pune

date.headline: Many baffled as their names go missing from voters’ list
date.text: Scores of voters in the Mysore Lok Sabha constituency were left feeling baffled and disappointed as they couldn’t cast their vote during the Lok Sabha elections on Thursday. The reason: their names were missing from the voters’ list.

asset.caption: Many baffled as their names go missing from voters’ list

date.headline: Six million Voters' Names Deleted in Maharashtra
date.text: In a shocking revelation that could impact election results, the names of nearly six million voters have been deleted or diverted across Maharashtra.

asset.caption: Six million Voters' Names Deleted in Maharashtra

date.headline: Thousands of voters’ names go missing in Mumbai
date.text: MUMBAI: Thousands of Mumbaikars, including several prominent personalities, we-re left vote-less on Thursday after their names were found missing from the electoral rolls. Many of them had cast their ballot in both the general and assembly elections in 2009 and carried valid voter identity cards. Others found their names on the deleted list of voters and were debarred this season.

asset.caption: Thousands of voters’ names go missing in Mumbai

date.headline: Huge turnout in sixth phase of election
date.text: On a day dominated by the wall-to-wall coverage on the electronic media of the road show which preceded the filing of nomination papers to the Varanasi Lok Sabha constituency by the BJP’s prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi, a record number of voters turned up to exercise their franchise for the 117 constituencies in the six phase of the election spread over 11 states and one union territory.

asset.caption: Huge turnout in sixth phase of election

date.headline: Eight polling officials, including 5 policemen, killed in Maoist attack in Dumka
date.text: Dumka, Jharkhand: Eight members of a polling team, including five jawans of the Jharkhand police, were killed this evening when a bus carrying them was blown off after hitting a landmine allegedly planted by the Maoists near Asnajore village in the Shikaripara police station of Jharkhand's Dumka district.

asset.caption: Eight polling officials, including 5 policemen, killed in Maoist attack in Dumka

date.headline: BJP asks Election Commission to stop Sonia Gandhi from airing message on DD, AIR
date.text: BJP today petitioned the Election Commission to stop Congress President Sonia Gandhi from airing her message on Doordarshan and AIR and said it is violative of the Model Code as it polarises the election scene among religious communities.

asset.caption: BJP asks Election Commission to stop Sonia Gandhi from airing message on DD, AIR

date.headline: EC to examine complaint against Modi’s marital status
date.text: A day after a complaint was filed against BJP’s prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi over his marital status, Chief Election Commissioner V.S. Sampath on Saturday said the Commission would examine it in accordance with the Supreme Court judgements.

asset.caption: EC to examine complaint against Modi’s marital status

date.headline: Mulayam's shocker on rape: Boys make mistakes, why hang them?
date.text: Moradabad: Uttar Pradesh politician Mulayam Singh Yadav has sparked outrage with his comments questioning the death sentence to three men who were convicted of two gang-rapes in Mumbai last week. "Should rape cases be punished with hanging? They are boys, they make mistakes," he said today while campaigning for the national election.

asset.caption: Mulayam's shocker on rape: Boys make mistakes, why hang them?

date.headline: EC bans Amit Shah, Azam Khan rallies
date.text: Taking serious exception to the failure of the U.P. government to file an FIR against Urban Development Minister Azam Khan for his communal utterances and to check inflammatory speeches by BJP leader Amit Shah, the Election Commission on Friday directed the Chief Secretary to initiate criminal proceedings against the two and ban public meetings where they are expected to be present.

asset.caption: EC bans Amit Shah, Azam Khan rallies

date.headline: Ex-adviser says Manmohan Singh was hobbled by Sonia Gandhi
date.text: A former media adviser to prime minister has alleged in a new book that Manmohan Singh allowed his authority to be undermined by Sonia Gandhi, president of the Congress party and standard-bearer of the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty.

asset.caption: Ex-adviser says Manmohan Singh was hobbled by Sonia Gandhi

date.headline: SHOCKING! Women having sex should be hanged, says Abu Azmi
date.text: In a bizarre and grotesque statement, the state Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Abu Azmi said women who were raped should also be punished. The statement came after this reporter questioned Azmi about SP chief Mulayam Singh Yadav’s comments on rape.

asset.caption: SHOCKING! Women having sex should be hanged, says Abu Azmi

date.headline: Third phase of LS polls ends: High turnout in 91 seats; Chandigarh tops with 74 per cent
date.text: High voter turnout was recorded in the 91 constituencies in 14 states and Union Territories which went to polls in the third and substantial phase of Lok Sabha elections, with Chandigarh witnessing the highest percentage of 74.

asset.caption: Third phase of LS polls ends: High turnout in 91 seats; Chandigarh tops with 74 per cent

date.headline: BJP removes Jaswant Singh's son Manvendra from party's national executive
date.text: New Delhi: The BJP on Thursday removed Manvendra Singh, expelled party leader Jaswant Singh's son who is the MLA from Sheo in Rajasthan, from its national executive.

asset.caption: BJP removes Jaswant Singh's son Manvendra from party's national executive

date.headline: Jammu & Kashmir Govt neglecting minority Hindus of Kashmir: JKVMe
date.text: An organisation of Kashmiri Pandits, Jammu Kashmir Vichar Manch (JKVM) today accused the state government of acting in a "communal and partisan manner" and neglecting the plight of the minority Hindus of Kashmir.

asset.caption: Jammu & Kashmir Govt neglecting minority Hindus of Kashmir: JKVMe

date.headline: Bangalore South to witness a high-profile battle
date.text: The incumbent MP, Ananth Kumar, is expected to get the Bharatiya Janata Party ticket and Infosys co-founder and Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) chairman Nandan Nilekani, the Congress ticket

asset.caption: Bangalore South to witness a high-profile battle

date.headline: Starry airs
date.text: Whether the Congress leadership finally gives him a ticket to the next Lok Sabha elections or not, Nandan Nilekani definitely seems to have caught a very special bug that is generally characteristic of the man heading the pack running our country at present — the hush bug. Nilekani, Chairman, Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI), had most mediapersons miffed as he turned up at the launch of its multilingual website an hour later than the scheduled time, flashed a smile and appeared clueless about the proceedings of the event.

asset.caption: Starry airs

date.headline: @wikileaks on Twitter
How Wikileaks dammed the Narendra Modi wave
date.text: So here's what happened; Wikileaks, an organisation run by information 'hactivist' Julian Assange, earlier today, put out a tweet from their official account denying that they ever endorsed BJP's prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi.

asset.caption: How Wikileaks dammed the Narendra Modi wave

date.headline: Applause as voter stops Chiranjeevi from jumping voters' queue
date.text: Hyderabad: Actor-politician Chiranjeevi was censured by voters today when he allegedly tried to jump the queue at a polling station in Andhra Pradesh.

asset.caption: Applause as voter stops Chiranjeevi from jumping voters' queue

date.headline: Two versions of attack on AAP supporters at Varanasi ghat
date.text: There are two versions of what triggered the attack on two Aam Aadmi Party supporters at a ghat in Varanasi on Monday evening.

asset.caption: Two versions of attack on AAP supporters at Varanasi ghat

date.headline: Minorities have reason to fear Modi, Amartya Sen says; Gujarat CM has vision of where he will take us, Jagdish Bhagwati argues
date.text: NEW DELHI: Amartya Sen, Nobel laureate, and Jagdish Bhagwati, considered by some as the greatest economist not to have won a Nobel, are known for their sharp ideological differences. They speak to TOI on Narendra Modi and the priorities of the next government.

asset.caption: Minorities have reason to fear Modi, Amartya Sen says; Gujarat CM has vision of where he will take us, Jagdish Bhagwati argues

date.headline: @narendramodi on twitter
date.text: Selfie is in! Share yours using #SelfieWithModi & see what happens https://mosaic.narendramodi.in/  pic.twitter.com/oDrCZztzo0

asset.caption: @narendramodi on twitter

date.headline: Tweeter who set off AAP-BJP war with beer, urinating tweet apologises
date.text: Hashmi Shams Tabreed, the journalist who kicked up a storm on Tuesday with his tweets where he alleged that "AAP folks had been engaged in a fight on Tuesday with people who objected to their drinking beer at Assi ghat and urinating in Ganga" has apologised for his tweets.

asset.caption: Tweeter who set off AAP-BJP war with beer, urinating tweet apologises

date.headline: Narendra Modi flashes party symbol, Congress demands FIR against Gujarat CM
date.text: Narendra Modi today landed in a controversy when he displayed his party symbol 'Lotus' and addressed the media after casting his vote, with the Congress moving the EC against the move and demanding that the poll body file an FIR against him. The Congress and Aam Aadmi Party have alleged it to be a violation of election code of conduct and demanded that action be taken against the Gujarat Chief Minister. The BJP's prime ministerial candidate was seen displaying a replica of Lotus, the party symbol, during his interaction with the press, after he cast his ballot today in Ranip area of city. Earlier, he was seen taking a photograph of himself with the replica of the party symbol at the venue of his media address after he casted his vote.

asset.caption: Narendra Modi flashes party symbol, Congress demands FIR against Gujarat CM

date.headline: @VishalDadlani on Twitter

asset.credit: Stuck between a moron and a murderer....what now, India!?

date.headline: @ANI_news on twitter
date.text: Why are Sonia Gandhi and Narendra Modi still silent on this comment by Ramdev?-Mayawati pic.twitter.com/RYZnDZdcOq

asset.caption: @ANI_news on twitter

date.headline: Politically correct on social media
date.text: The 16th General (Lok Sabha) Elections 2014 has found its way in conversations not just in political circles but also on social media. And Twitter seems to be the platform of choice to vent anger/resentment/disappointment or to simply woo supporters. Candidates, journalists and citizens are using social media extensively to discover election-related content and converse with others real time.

asset.caption: Politically correct on social media

date.headline: @ANI_news on Twitter

asset.credit: Amartya Sen is working for Naxalites & his Leftist friends : Subramanian Swamy on Sen's comments on Modi

date.headline: Parliamentary constituency-wise dominance of religion in constituencies

asset.caption: Parliamentary constituency-wise dominance of religion in constituencies

date.headline: NDA's performance on overall economic parameters worse than UPA's: Study
date.text: Compared to the NDA rule, the UPA tenure of eight years has been characterised by faster growth, higher savings and investment, growing foreign trade and capital inflows and increased infrastructure spending, according to a a new study by three economists in three universities.

asset.caption: NDA's performance on overall economic parameters worse than UPA's: Study

date.headline: Election Commission finds Congress' Milind Deora, Sanjay Nirupam among four guilty of paid news
date.text: In all, 84 complaints of paid news were received by a committee specially set up to keep a watch on paid news. Complaints against Congress candidates - Union Minister of State for Shipping and IT Milind Deora (Mumbai South), Sanjay Nirupam (Mumbai North), Vishwajit Kadam (Pune) - and BJP candidate from Pune Deepak Shirole have been found true, sources in the State Election Office said.

asset.caption: Election Commission finds Congress' Milind Deora, Sanjay Nirupam among four guilty of paid news

date.headline: India's social media election battle
date.text: Politicians are taking part in Google+ Hangouts, televised interviews organised by Facebook and using the Facebook-owned smart phone messaging app WhatsApp to connect with millions of tech-savvy urban voters.

asset.caption: India's social media election battle

date.headline: India elections: Gandhi, Kejriwal, Modi in war of words
date.text: So what makes these leaders tick for their respective parties? And what do they tell people in their rallies? BBC Monitoring's Vikas Pandey uses word cloud analysis to find out the answers.

asset.caption: India elections: Gandhi, Kejriwal, Modi in war of words

date.headline: India elections: Battleground seats
date.text: The BBC Monitoring profiles some of the most hotly-contested seats.

asset.caption: India elections: Battleground seats

date.headline: Indian media: Crucial voting phase
date.text: Media feel the seventh phase of India's general election is "a make or break day" for many prominent politicians.

asset.caption: Indian media: Crucial voting phase

date.headline: India Begins World’s Largest Election
date.text: India’s 814 million registered electors are heading to the voting in stages over the next five weeks in the planet’s largest exercise in democracy. The opposition BJP, making promises of economic change, is looking strong in the opinion polls

asset.caption: India Begins World’s Largest Election

date.headline: Meet India's biggest living election loser
date.text: K Padmarajan, who is contesting against Narendra Modi, has made record 158 abortive attempts to succeed in elections.

asset.caption: Meet India's biggest living election loser

date.headline: India elections fail to inspire Kashmiris
date.text: Low voter turnout and boycott mar parliamentary elections in India-administered Kashmir.

asset.caption: India elections fail to inspire Kashmiris

date.headline: Villagers to boycott polls in Gandhi bastion
date.text: About two dozen villages in Amethi represented by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi vow not to vote as their demands not met.

asset.caption: Villagers to boycott polls in Gandhi bastion

date.headline: Can India's AAP repeat success outside Delhi?
date.text: Anti-corruption party tries to make inroads into Gurgaon as mainstream parties face scrutiny over past performance.

asset.caption: Can India's AAP repeat success outside Delhi?

date.headline: In Pictures: Meghalaya goes to polls
date.text: People in northeastern Indian state of Meghalaya have voted in the second phase of parliamentary elections along with neighbouring states of Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur and Nagaland.

asset.caption: In Pictures: Meghalaya goes to polls

date.headline: BJP chief: Riot guilty will be punished
date.text: Indian opposition leader Rajnath Singh tells Al Jazeera that accused in Muzaffarnagar riots will be brought to book.

asset.caption: BJP chief: Riot guilty will be punished

date.headline: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh accepts his relationship with journalist Amrita Rai on Twitter
date.text: In a series of tweets, senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has accepted his relationship with journalist Amrita Rai.

asset.caption: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh accepts his relationship with journalist Amrita Rai on Twitter

date.headline: Being Muslim Under Narendra Modi
date.text: AHMEDABAD, India — Late last month I bought an Indian comic book online. I hadn’t bought one since the mid-80s, when I was a boy and would walk to the bookstore in my hometown in Kashmir to pick up copies of D.C. and Marvel Comics, or Amar Chitra Katha, a series based on the lives of major contemporary, historical and mythological figures in India. My latest purchase, “Bal Narendra” (“Boy Narendra”), was styled after Amar Chitra Katha.

asset.caption: Being Muslim Under Narendra Modi

date.headline: Shankar Sharma & Devina Mehra: The strange case for India's macroeconomic exceptionalism
date.text: Over the past couple of years, and particularly the past few months, we have become convinced that economists, the intelligentsia, fund managers, foreign brokers, don't read global macroeconomic news.

asset.caption: Shankar Sharma & Devina Mehra: The strange case for India's macroeconomic exceptionalism

date.headline: THE MOB, THE MEDIA & SOMNATH BHARTI
date.text: Bhupendra Chaubey, CNN-IBN’s National Affairs Editor, who happened to be in the crowd, plunged himself into the mob and tried rescuing Bharti who was more football than human by now, but found himself pinned down as well. Sensing serious trouble, Abhay Tripathi, a reporter with CNN-IBN, dragged Bharti away and somehow managed to push him inside the nearest car – which happened to be the one I had hired for the day.

asset.caption: THE MOB, THE MEDIA & SOMNATH BHARTI

date.headline: Election Commission directs FIR against Pravin Togadia for ‘hate speech’
date.text: On Monday evening, Gujarat's chief electoral officer Anita Karwal said, "We have inquired about the Bhavnagar incident and have directed the district administration to file an FIR in the matter."

asset.caption: Election Commission directs FIR against Pravin Togadia for ‘hate speech’

asset.caption: MANY-FESTOES

date.headline: Modi as Pakistan’s candidate
date.text: A NEIGHBOUR in Delhi, who happens to be a Narendra Modi devotee, asked me which leader Pakistanis would want as India’s next prime minister.

asset.caption: Modi as Pakistan’s candidate

date.headline: Narendra Modi Interview: Watch unseen aspects of Modi's life Exclusive on NewsX
date.text: Madhu Kishwar is talking in detail about Life threat on Narendra Modi. She also talks in detail about the propaganda machinery acting to malign the image of Gujarat and India as whole. Narendra Modi opens up on the biggest question marks on his records. He opens up on battles he fought as Gujarat Chief Minister. He also speaks on his battles with red tape and corruption.

asset.caption: Narendra Modi Interview: Watch unseen aspects of Modi's life Exclusive on NewsX

date.headline: WHOSE MODI INTERVIEW IS IT?
date.text: The biggest brand this election season – and this, anyone who’s not been living in a cave would agree – is Narendra Modi. Modi sells and no one knows it better than the media. He’s suddenly omnipresent. Other than when it comes to the world of news. Media houses can speak of him, but they just can’t speak to him. Which is why NewsX  (and its sister Hindi news channel, India News) must have thought that they’d catch every eyeball in the country when they announced that they had landed the “biggest interview of the decade” with Narendra Modi.

asset.caption: WHOSE MODI INTERVIEW IS IT?

date.headline: Modi backs out of Facebook Talks Live citing conditions not met
date.text: The BJP's Prime Ministerial candidate is notoriously difficult to catch for media interviews but has backed out of an interaction on Facebook Talks Live at the last minute after organisers said he laid down conditions they couldn't fulfill.

asset.caption: Modi backs out of Facebook Talks Live citing conditions not met

date.headline: @TOILucknow on Twitter
date.text: #AAP candidate from Lucknow Javed Jaferi after casting his vote #LucknowVotes #DanceOfDemocracy pic.twitter.com/i7vYX39DZI

date.headline: @NSaina on Twitter
date.text: I did my bit! Go vote pic.twitter.com/tAlTphShMt

date.headline: CANDIDATES 2014: LET THE GOSSIP STOP
date.text: The biggest and most obvious talking point was Narendra Modi cancelling on us, leaving us heartbroken.

asset.caption: CANDIDATES 2014: LET THE GOSSIP STOP

date.headline: Third front options
date.text: Unless the combined tally of the Congress and the BJP falls below 272 seats, which is highly improbable at this point of time, a third front stands no chance of forming a government of its own.

asset.caption: Third front options

date.headline: AIADMK wants Jayalalithaa as prime minister
date.text: The general council of the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) said on Thursday that it would like to see party chief and Tamil Nadu chief minister J. Jayalalithaa become the country’s prime minister—a move that effectively rules out an alliance between the party and either of the two main national parties, the Indian National Congress and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

asset.caption: AIADMK wants Jayalalithaa as prime minister

date.headline: Blow to third front as Left, Jayalalithaa part ways
date.text: Cracks surfaced in the ‘alternative front’ of parties with an alliance between two key constituents, the Left Front and Jayalalithaa’s AIADMK, ending in Tamil Nadu after failing to agree on seats. It was the Left that called it off.

asset.caption: Blow to third front as Left, Jayalalithaa part ways

date.headline: NDTV Opinion Poll: In Odisha, Naveen Patnaik emerges stronger
date.text: NDTV's opinion poll shows a near-dream run for Naveen Patnaik, the Chief Minister of Odisha, in the national election. Mr Patnaik's BJD sweeps the state, winning 18 of the state's 21 seats.

asset.caption: NDTV Opinion Poll: In Odisha, Naveen Patnaik emerges stronger

date.headline: Can support Jayalalithaa as PM, but not Narendra Modi: Mamata Banerjee
date.text: Kolkata: Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee today indicated that she is open to working with AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa or BSP leader Mayawati in a post poll scenario, but dismissed any possibility of supporting a Narendra Modi-led government.

asset.caption: Can support Jayalalithaa as PM, but not Narendra Modi: Mamata Banerjee

date.headline: Jayalalithaa demolishes Modi model
date.text: Matching Modi in word play and smart oneliners, Tamil Nadu chief minister and AIADMK supremo J Jayalalithaa on Monday demolished the Gujarat model with facts and asked people to decide between Narendra Modi in Tamil Nadu or Lady in India.

asset.caption: Jayalalithaa demolishes Modi model

date.headline: Modi's poll-day speech was made outside restricted area, say Gujarat investigators
date.text: A day after the BJP’s prime ministerial nominee Narendra Modi was booked for making a speech at a polling booth while displaying his party’s election symbol in violation of electoral laws, a preliminary probe by the Gujarat Police has found he addressed the gathering outside the restricted 100-metre radius.

asset.caption: Modi's poll-day speech was made outside restricted area, say Gujarat investigators

date.headline: Chiranjeevi shook my hand after I reprimanded him
date.text: He just shook my hand and said "OK" and went back in the queue.

asset.caption: Chiranjeevi shook my hand after I reprimanded him

date.headline: HT looks back at 62 years and 15 elections that made Indian democracy robust

asset.caption: HT looks back at 62 years and 15 elections that made Indian democracy robust

date.headline: Digital democracy: who is winning war for votes on Twitter
date.text: The Indian voter is on fire these days, powering the surging turnout in what is being touted as the first truly digital elections of the world’s largest democracy.

asset.caption: Digital democracy: who is winning war for votes on Twitter

date.headline: Narendra Modi Blames Congress After 'First Ever FIR' Against Him
date.text: Tirupati: Narendra Modi has said he will not forget April 30, 2014, the day an FIR or first information report was lodged against him, the first ever.

asset.caption: Narendra Modi Blames Congress After 'First Ever FIR' Against Him

date.headline: BJP leader ‘gangraped’ in Ranchi village
date.text: A senior office-bearer of the Jharkhand BJP's minority wing has alleged in an FIR that she was told to stop working with the saffron party by regional political forces before being raped by seven men on Monday.

asset.caption: BJP leader ‘gangraped’ in Ranchi village

date.headline: BHU prof arrested for instigating attack on AAP's Somnath Bharti
date.text: A professor of the Banaras Hindu University was arrested on Thursday for allegedly instigating BJP workers to attack Aam Aadmi Party leader Somnath Bharti at Assi Ghat in Varanasi last week.

asset.caption: BHU prof arrested for instigating attack on AAP's Somnath Bharti

date.headline: Inside Amit Shah's 'social media war room', election activities are monitored in UP
date.text: Welcome to the ‘social media war room’ of BJP on the first floor of the party’s state unit headquarters in Lucknow’s Lalbagh. From this place, apart from monitoring Twitter, Facebook and a constant flow of news, a team tracks the smallest of households the BJP has touched, ground challenges, profile and leanings of each voter, resources needed to win in a booth or constituency, and much more. It is an unprecedented deployment of smart youngsters and technology to control every inch of BJP’s crucial battlefields, UP and cyberspace.

asset.caption: Inside Amit Shah's 'social media war room', election activities are monitored in UP

date.headline: In India, Election Officials Brave Hungry Crocodiles to Reach Voters
date.text: Government Goes to Extraordinary Lengths in Largely Rural and Infrastructure-Challenged Country

asset.caption: In India, Election Officials Brave Hungry Crocodiles to Reach Voters

date.headline: Records of poll code violation gutted in fire: RTI query
date.text: Records of violations of code of conduct in previous three Lok Sabha polls have been destroyed in fire, a response to a RTI query has revealed.

asset.caption: Records of poll code violation gutted in fire: RTI query

date.headline: ‘Modi vs. all’ shows up insecurities of rival camp: Amit Shah
date.text: On Wednesday, as the seventh phase of polling was under way, Amit Shah, closest confidant of the Bharatiya Janata Party’s prime ministerial candidate, Narendra Modi, and party general secretary, seemed relaxed and hopeful. He had just cast his vote and was watching television with his wife, Sonal, and son, Jayant, at home in a quiet neighbourhood of Ahmedabad. Mr. Shah opened up to Poornima Joshi on the sudden bitterness in the election campaign, the prospects of finding future allies for the BJP in such an atmosphere and his relationship with party president Rajnath Singh.

asset.caption: ‘Modi vs. all’ shows up insecurities of rival camp: Amit Shah

date.headline: John Oliver On Indian Elections 2014 - Narendra Modi Vs. Rahul Gandhi
Why did the EC set up an entire polling booth just for this man?
date.text: Bharatdas Darshandas lives in solitary splendor in an ashram in Banej, 20 km deep in Gujarat’s Gir forest. On Wednesday, a clutch of five Election Commission officials and a policeman gathered at a watchpost deep in the jungle to transform it into a polling booth solely to cater to the 65-year-old priest.

asset.caption: Why did the EC set up an entire polling booth just for this man?

date.headline: What's the only question worth asking about Digvijaya Singh and Amrita Rai?
date.text: Who hacked her computer and leaked her private messages to the world?

asset.caption: What's the only question worth asking about Digvijaya Singh and Amrita Rai?

date.headline: THE ARTICLE VANISHES
date.text: On April 29, one of the most widely shared news on the Indian Internet scene – pictures of Digvijay Singh romancing a journalist notwithstanding of course – was an article on DNA titled “Mamata Banerjee calls Narendra Modi ‘butcher of Gujarat’; here are 9 myth busters on 2002 post-Godhra riots”. The article, according to the author, “proud Congress supporter” Shehzad Poonawalla, was essentially a nine-point listicle “busting nine myths” about Gujarat “perpetrated by Narendra Modi’s PR machinery”.

asset.caption: THE ARTICLE VANISHES

date.headline: The article on Modi and Gujrat riots which went missing from DNA exists on Archive.org

The article, according to the author, “proud Congress supporter” Shehzad Poonawalla, was essentially a nine-point listicle “busting nine myths” about Gujarat “perpetrated by Narendra Modi’s PR machinery”.
